REF AD2.22.5.1.3 COORDINATION WITH NETWORK : READ : 'CDG AIRPORT PDS IS DIRECTLY CONNECTED WITH THE NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER (NMOC) FOR DATA EXCHANGE (COLLABORATIVE MANAGEMENT OF FLIGHT UPDATES). DATA ARE AUTOMATICALLY EXCHANGED THROUGH DPI AND API MESSAGES, WHICH INCLUDE TARGET TAKE-OFF TIMES, TAKEN INTO ACCOUNT BY NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER FOR EN ROUTE TRAFFIC PREDICTION AND FOR SLOT ALLOCATION. DPI AND API ARE OF DIFFERENT TYPES : GENERAL ARRIVAL PLANNING INFORMATION (G-API) PREDICTED DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION EARLY DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (E-DPI) TARGET DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (T-DPI) ATC DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (A-DPI) CANCEL DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (C-DPI) THE REA MESSAGE IS NO LONGER USED AND REPLACED BY DPI MESSAGES SYSTEMATICALLY AND AUTOMATICALLY SENT. INSTEAD OF : 'CDG AIRPORT PDS IS DIRECTLY CONNECTED WITH THE NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER FOR DATA EXCHANGE (COLLABORATIVE MANAGEMENT OF FLIGHT UPDATES). DATA ARE AUTOMATICALLY EXCHANGED THROUGH DPI MESSAGES, WHICH INCLUDE TARGET TAKE-OFF TIMES, TAKEN INTO ACCOUNT BY NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER FOR EN ROUTE TRAFFIC PREDICTION AND FOR SLOT ALLOCATION. DPI ARE OF DIFFERENT TYPES : EARLY DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (E-DPI) TARGET DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (T-DPI) ATC DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (A-DPI) THE REA MESSAGE IS NO LONGER USED AND REPLACED BY DPI MESSAGES SYSTEMATICALLY AND AUTOMATICALLY SENT.'

SX0163/24 AIP SUPPLEMENT LFPG/PARIS/CHARLES DE GAULLE VALIDITY:16SEP24-02NOV24 RECONFIGURATION WORKS ON AIRCRAFT STATION U10 AND REFURBISHMENT OF A SECTION OF TAXIWAY A. THIS WORK REQUIRES THE CLOSURE OF A SECTION OF TAXIWAY A 24 HOURS PER DAY. PHASE 1: TAXIWAY A BETWEEN STANDS S24 AND S30 24 HOURS PER DAY: AIRCRAFT STANDS CLOSED 24 HOURS PER DAY: U10 S24 TO S30 IMPACT ON OPERATIONS : THE CLOSURE OF A SECTION OF TAXIWAY A BETWEEN AIRCRAFT STANDS S24 TO S30 CREATES A DEAD-END: - ONLY AIRCRAFT OPERATING TERMINAL 1 AND SIERRA STANDS CAN ACCESS TAXIWAY A IN ITS WESTERN SECTION - ONLY AIRCRAFT OPERATING TERMINAL 1 STANDS CAN ACCESS TAXIWAY A3 - NOTE THAT TAXIWAY A3 IS RESTRICTED TO AIRCRAFT WITH A MAXIMUM WINGSPAN OF 61M - S23 AIRCRAFT STAND IS LIMITED TO AIRCRAFT WITH A MAXIMUM WINGSPAN OF 36M. THE AIRCRAFT STANDS LISTED BELOW AND LOCATED NEAR THE WORK ZONE ARE SUBJECT TO SPECIAL PUSH-BACK PROCEDURES: U07: RED PUSH MANDATORY ON TAXIWAY A S23: PUSH-BACK ON TAXIWAY A HEADING WEST PROHIBITED. PUSH-BACK HEADING SOUTH ON TAXIWAY A3 ALLOWED FOR DEPARTURE TO TAXIWAY A S31: PUSH-BACK ON TAXIWAY A HEADING EAST PROHIBITED. PUSH-BACK ON TAXIWAY A HEADING SOUTH ALLOWED FOR DEPARTURE TO TAXIWAY NA1. THE AIRCRAFT STANDS LISTED BELOW ARE SUBJECT TO RED PUSH PROCEDURES ONLY: X03 Y03 Y05 Y08 Z03 Z04 Z05 Z07 Z09 THE AIRCRAFT STANDS LISTED BELOW ARE SUBJECT TO THE WEST HEADING PUSH-BACK PROCEDURES ONLY: S06 TO S22 THE AIRCRAFT STANDS LISTED BELOW ARE SUBJECT TO WEST HEADING TOWING PROCEDURES ONLY: S6B S7B S8B S9B

THE CHAPTER 22.2.3 IS UPDATED ACCORDINGLY: 22.2.3 COORDINATION WITH NETWORK ORLY AIRPORT PDS IS DIRECTLY CONNECTED TO THE NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER (NMOC) FOR DATA EXCHANGE (COLLABORATIVE MANAGEMENT OF FLIGHT UPDATES). DATA ARE AUTOMATICALLY EXCHANGED THROUGH DPI AND API MESSAGES WHICH INCLUDE TARGET TAKE-OFF TIME AND ESTIMED LANDING TIME, TAKEN INTO ACCOUNT BY THE NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER FOR EN-ROUTE TRAFFIC PREDICTION AND FOR SLOT ALLOCATION. DIFFERENT TYPES OF DPI AND API ARE: -GENERAL ARRIVAL PLANNING INFORMATION (G-API) -PREDICTED DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (P-DPI) -EARLY DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (E-DPI) -TARGET DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (T-DPI) -ATC DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (A-DPI) -CANCEL DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (C-DPI) THE REA MESSAGE IS NO LONGER TO BE USED REA AS IT IS REPLACED BY DPI MESSSAGES SYSTEMATICALLY AND AUTOMATICALLY SENT. REF AIP AD2 22.2.3

SX0089/24 AIP SUPPLEMENT LFPB/PARIS/LE BOURGET MODIFICATION AIP FRANCE AD2 LFPB REGARDING SB CONVENTIONAL DEP PROC FM PARIS - LE BOURGET FURTHER TO PTV VOR AND NDB POY EXTINCTION VALIDITY: 13JUN24- 30OCT24 VOR PTV FM THE 12/29/2022 RPLC BY THE WPT (5LNC) OLZOM, NDB POY FM 15/06/23 RPLC BY WPT OXCEL. RESULTS IN THE MODIFICATION OF THE SB CONVENTIONAL DEP PROC BASED ON THIS AID.TEMPO OPR PROC ARE IMPLEMENTED IN ORDER TO HANDLE THE SB DEP ACFT, WHILE AWAITING THE DESIGN OF NEW RNAV STD INITIAL DEP PROC - ALL SID PTV DEP LFPB ARE REMOVED. - ALL SIDS USING POY DEP FM LE BOURGET ARE AFFECTED BY THE EXTINCTION OF NDB POY. SOME INITIAL PARTS OF SID MONOT AND DORDI DEP FM LFPB ARE NOT AFFECTED AND THEREFORE REMAIN USABLE.THE NEW WP OXCEL REPLACES POY AND MUST BE INPUT IN NAVIGATION SYSTEMS OF AIRPLANES DEPARTING FROM LE BOURGET THAT USE THESE ROUTES. ******************************** DEP 07/09 TO OLZOM / MONOT WITH SID LFPB 5J IN FORCE - SID CONV MONOT 5J NOT USABLE - SID DORDI 5J REMAINS USABLE - THE FLW DEP CLR CONFIRMED BY AD DELIVERY : FLW DEP SID CONV DORDI 5J CMB 3000 FT AMSL, UP TO D 17.1 NM FM MLN, THEN EXP VECTORING TO OLZOM OR MONOT - RADIOCOMMUNICATION FAILURE : SQUAWK 7600 FLW DEP SID CONV DORDI 5J CMB 3000 FT AMSL, UP TO D 17.1 NM FM MLN, THEN PCD DCT OLZOM OR MONOT COMPLY WITH THE LAST LVL CLEARED BY ATC TIL D 40 NM LOL THEN CONT THE FLT ACCORDING FPL IN FORCE ******************************** DEP 07/09 TO OLZOM / MONOT WITH SID LFPB 5M IN FORCE - SID DORDI 5M NOT USABLE - SID MONOT 5M REMAINS USABLE IN ITS INITIAL PART UP TO RADIAL 073 TSU INCLUDED. - THE FLW DEP CLR CONFIRMED BY AD DELIVERY : FLW THE INITIAL PART OF THE DEP SID MONOT 5M CMB FL 070, THEN INTERCEPT AND FLW THE 073 TSU (MAG 253), THEN PSG BT 180 RADIAL TURN LEFT MAG 190, THEN EXP VECTORING TO OXCEL THEN OLZOM OR MONOT OR DORDI - RADIOCOMMUNICATION FAILURE : SQUAWK 7600 FLW THE INITIAL PART OF THE DEP SID MONOT 5M CMB FL 070, THEN INTERCEPT AND FLW THE 073 TSU (MAG 253), THEN PSG BT 180 RADIAL TURN LEFT MAG 190 TOWARDS OXCEL, THEN PCD DCT TO OLZOM OR MONOT OR DORDI COMPLY WITH THE LAST LVL CLEARED BY ATC TIL D 40 NM LOL THEN CONT THE FLT ACCORDING FPL IN FORCE ******************************** DEP 25 TO OLZOM / MONOT/ DORDI WITH SID LFPB 5C AND 5F IN FORCE - PARTS OF SID MONOT 5C / 5F AND DORDI 5C / 5F ARE NO LONGER USABLE AFT 12 NM FM BT. - THE FLW DEP CLR CONFIRMED BY AD DELIVERY : FLW THE INITIAL PART OF THE DEP SID CONV MONOT 5C OR 5F CMB 4000 FT AMSL ON RADIAL BT 245 RADIAL, THEN AT 12 NM FM BT, TURN LEFT MAG 123 THEN EXP VECTORING TO OXCEL THEN OLZOM, MONOT OR DORDI. - RDO COM FAILURE: SQUAWK 7600 FLW THE INITIAL PART OF THE DEP SID CONV MONOT 5C OR 5F CMB 4000 FT AMSL ON BT 245 RADIAL, THEN AT 12 NM FM BT, PCD DCT OXCEL THEN DCT OLZOM, MONOT OR DORDI COMPLY WITH THE LAST LVL CLEARED BY ATC TIL D 40 NM LOL THEN CONT THE FLT ACCORDING FPL IN FORCE ******************************** DEP TO RWY 21 TO OLZOM/ MONOT/ DORDI W WITH SID 5C AND 5F - DEP CLR TO BE EXP : INITIAL DEP AGOPA 5P CMB 4000 FT AMSL THEN, ENR TO PB253, INTERCEPT BT 245 RADIAL, THEN AT 12 NM FM BT, TURN LEFT MAG TRACK 123, THEN EXP VECTORING TO OXCEL THEN OLZOM, MONOT OR DORDI. - RDO COM FAILURE : SQUAWK 7600 FLW INITIAL DEP AGOPA 5P CMB 4000 FT AMSL THEN, ENR TO PB253, INTERCEPT BT 245 RADIAL , THEN AT 12 NM FM BT, TURN LEFT DCT OXCEL THEN PCD DCT OLZOM, MONOT OR DORDI COMPLY WITH THE LAST LVL CLEARED BY ATC TIL D 40 NM LOL THEN CONT THE FLT ACCORDING FPL IN FORCE ******************************************* DEP TO RWY 21 TO OLZOM/ MONOT/ DORDI E WITH SID 5J -DEP CLR TO BE EXP : INITIAL DEP AGOPA 5Q CMB 3000 FT AMSL THEN, ENR TO PB093, INTERCEPT MLN 360 RADIAL, THEN EXP VECTORING TO OLZOM, MONOT OR DORDI. - ADS-B DATA FOR ECRA (EUROPEAN CONNECTED REGIONAL AIRPORTS PROGRAMME) OPERATIONS. 1.1.IN ORDER TO COOPERATE WITH ADS-B RECEIVER USED BY AIRPORT OPERATOR AND EUROCONTROL FOR USE OF THE ECRA PROGRAMME AT EINDHOVEN AIRPORT,PILOTS OF MODE S EQUIPPED ACFT WITH ADS-B FUNCTIONALITIES WHEN OPERATING ON THE GROUND SHALL: A)SELECT AUTO MODE AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A CODE OR B)IF AUTOMODE IS NOT AVAILABLE, SELECT ON (E.G.XPDR) AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A CODE. -FROM THE REQUEST FOR TOWER PUSH-BACK OR TAXI,WHICHEVER IS EARLIER -AFTER LANDING,CONTINUOUSLY UNTIL THE ACFT IS FULLY PARKED IN ITS STAND. -WHEN THE ACFT IS FULLY PARKED, FLT CREW SHALL SELECT STBY. 1.1.2.WHENEVER THE ACFT IS CAPABLE OF REPORTING ACFT IDENTIFICATION (I.E.CALLSIGN USED IN FLT), THIS SHOULD BE ENTERED (THROUGH THE FMS OR THE TRANSPONDER CONTROL PANEL) AT THE TIME OF THE REQUEST FOR TOWED PUSH-BACK OR TAXI, WHICHEVER IS EARLIER. 1.1.3.AIR CREW MUST USE THE ICAO DEFINED FORMAT TO ENTER THE ACFT IDENTIFICATION. 1.1.4.TO ENSURE THAT THE PERFORMANCE OF SYSTEMS BASED ON SSR FREQ (INCLUDING AIRBORNE TCAS AND SSR RADARS) IS NOT COMPROMISED, TCAS SHOULD NOT BE SELECTED BEFORE RECEIVING CLEARANCE TO LINE UP, AND SHOULD BE DESELECTED AFTER VACATING THE RWY.

FOR OVERFLIGHTS OR ARRIVALS, LOGON MUST BE INITIATED BY THE PILOT, WITH SUFFICIENT NOTICE (BETWEEN 10 AND 25 MINUTES BEFORE ENTERING THE CRNA), TO ENSURE THAT THE CONNECTION IS ESTABLISHED, AND WITH THE FIRST FRENCH ACC CROSSED. IF LOGON HAS ALREADY BEEN ESTABLISHED WITH AN ADJACENT UPSTREAM ACC PROVIDING LOGON FORWARD, OR IF FORWARD HAS FAILED, ADVANCE NOTICE IS NOT REQUIRED. FOR FLIGHTS DEPARTING FROM FRENCH AIRFIELDS, LOGON MUST BE INITIATED NO LATER THAN CROSSING FL150. IF LOGON IS IMPOSSIBLE FOR A TECHNICAL REASON KNOWN OR UNKNOWN TO THE E PILOT, THE CREW WILL ANNOUNCE 'UNABLE CPDLC'. REFERENCE AIP FRANCE GEN 3.4-9.

AX0002/24 AIC RESTRICTION HLLL/TRIPOLI FIR VALIDITY: 02OCT-UFN IATA IN FLIGHT BROADCAST PROCEDURE (IFBP) - AFI REGION 1.LISTENING WATCH IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT A LISTENING WATCH SHOULD BE MNTN ON THE DESIGNATED FREQ (126.9MHZ), 10 MIN BFR ENTERING THE DESIGNATED AIRSPACE TIL LVE THE AIRSPACE. FOR AN ACFT TKOF FM AN AD LOCATED WI THE LATERAL LIMITS OF THE DESIGNATED AIRSPACE, LISTENING WATCH SHOULD START AS SOON AS APPROPRIATE AND BE MNTN TIL LVE THE AIRSPACE. 2.BROADCASTS INTERVALS IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT A BCST SHOULD BE PRONOUNCED IN ENGLISH AS FLW: -10 MIN BFR, ENTERING AN FIR WI THE IFBP REGION -UPON ENTERING AN FIR WI THE IFBP REGION -AS SOON AS PRACTICABLE WHEN DEP FM AN AD LOCATED WI THE IFBP REGION -10 MIN BFR XNG OR JOINING AN ATS RTE OR XNG AN AWY OR WPT -EV 20 MIN -BFR A CHANGE IN FL -UPON RCH THE INTENDED FL -AT ANY OTHER TIME CONSIDERED NECESSARY BY THE PILOT. NOTE 1: IN THE INTEREST OF REDUCING CONGESTION ON THE IFBP FREQ, PILOTS MAY EXER DISCRETION TO OMIT CLOSELY SPACED REPETITIVE IFBP REPORTS, HOWEVER BCST INTERVALS SHOULD NOT EXCEED 20 MIN. NOTE 2: IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT THE IFBP FREQ 126.9 IS CLOSELY MNT AT ALL TIMES WHEN IN THE REGION; FOR EXAMPLE, NOT TO TURN OFF OR REDUCE VOLUME LEVELS ON THE TRANSMITTING/RECEIVING FREQ. 3.BROADCAST PROCEDURE IT IS RECOMMENDED A BCST MSG SHOULD BE STRUCTURED AS FLW: ALL STATIONS THIS IS ABC123 (FLT NR) IN THE XXXX (FIR NAME) FIR. ABC123 (FLT NR) AT FL (ALT MNTN) DIRECTION BOUND (DIRECTION) IN THE XXXX (FIR NAME) FIR. 4. OPERATING PROCEDURES 4.1. CHANGES IN CRUISING LVL ARE CONSIDERED NECESSARY BY PILOTS TO AVOID TFC CONFLICTS, FOR WEATHER AVOIDANCE, OR OTHER VALID OPR REASONS. WHEN CRUISING LVL CHANGES ARE UNAVOIDABLE, ALL AVBL ACFT LGT, WHICH WOULD IMPR THE VISUAL DETECTION OF THE ACFT, SHOULD BE DISPLAYED WHILE CHANGING LEVELS. 4.2. COLLISION AVOIDANCE IF, ON RECEIPT OF A TFC INFO BCST FM ANOTHER ACFT, A PILOT TAKES A DECISION THAT IMMEDIATE ACTION IS NECESSARY TO AVOID AN IMMINENT COLLISION RISK TO HIS ACFT AND THIS CANNOT BE ACHIEVED FLW THE RIGHT-OF-WAY PROVISIONS OF ANNEX 2, HE SHOULD: UNLESS AN ALTERNATIVE MANEUVER APPEARS MORE APPROPRIATE, CLIMB OR DESCEND 500FT; DISPLAY ALL AVBL ACFT LGT WHICH WOULD IMPR THE VISUAL DETECTION OF THE ACFT; ASAP REPLY TO THE BCST ADVISING ACTION BEING TAKEN, AND SPECIFY ALT MNTN; NOTIFY THE ACTION TAKEN ON THE APPROPRIATE ATS FREQ; AS SOON AS THE SITUATION HAS BEEN RECTIFIED, RESUME THE ALLOCATED FL, NOTIFYING THE ACTION ON THE APPROPRIATE ATS FREQ. 4.3. NORMAL POSITION REPORTING PROCEDURES NML PSN REP PROC SHOULD BE CONT AT ALL TIMES, REGARDLESS OF ANY ACTION TAKEN TO INITIATE OR ACK A TFC INFO BCST. 4.4. OPERATION OF TRANSPONDERS PILOTS SHALL ENSURE THAT TRANSPONDER PROC AS CONTAINED IN ICAO PANS OPS DOC 8168 ARE COMPLIED WITH AND IN THE ABSENCE OF OTHER DIRECTIONS FM ATC, OPR THE TRANSPONDER ON MODE A AND C CODE 2000. PILOTS SHALL ENSURE OPERATION OF TRANSPONDERS EVEN WHEN OUTSIDE RADAR COVERAGE IN ORDER TO ENABLE TCAS EQUIPPED ACFT TO IDENTIFY CONFLICTING TFC. USE OF TCAS IN ACCORDANCE WITH ICAO ANNEX 6 ALL TURBINE-ENG AIRPLANES OF A MAX CERTIFICATED TKOF MASS IN EXCESS OF 5700 KG OR AUTH TO CARRY MORE THAN 19 PAX SHALL BE EQUIPPED WITH ACAS II. IATA RECOMMENDS THE USE OF AN OPERABLE TCAS WHEN OPR WI THE CONTINENT OF AFRICA; AND RECOMMENDS SELECTION OF TA/RA MODE AT MAX RANGE. 4.5. USE OF SLOP: SLOP IS PROMOTED IN AFI REGION. 5. THE IFBP IN AFI IN MANY FIRS IN THE AFI REGION COM BOTH FIXED AND MOBILE HAVE EITHER NOT BEEN IMPLEMENTED OR OPR WELL BLW THE REQUIRED RELIABILITY. THIS HAS AN IMPACT ON THE PROPER PROVISION OF ATS, ESPECIALLY FIS. CONSEQUENTLY, THE AFI REGIONAL TECHNICAL CONFERENCE HAS DECIDED THAT THE IATA IN-FLT BCST PROC (IFBP) SHOULD BE USED WI DESIGNATED FIRS IN THE REGION AS AN INTERIM MEASURE TIL SUCH TIME AS COM FAC AFFECTING THE FIRS IN QUESTION HAVE BEEN IMPROVED. 6. DESIGNATED FREQ IN AFI FOR THE IFBP IS 126.9 MHZ. 7. IN THE AFI REGION THE IFBP SHOULD BE APPLIED IN THE FLW FIRS AND AIRSPACES: ASMARA, BRAZZAVILLE, KANO, KHARTOUM, KINSHASA, LUANDA, LUSAKA, TRIPOLI, MOGADISHU, NIAMEY, N DJAMENA, DAKAR.
